intro: Commersonia novoguinensis, commonly known as the New Zealand commersonia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Proteaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form. The plant features lance-shaped leaves with a leathery texture and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers. It is typically found in coastal and lowland areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Commersonia novoguinensis plays a role in local ecosystems and is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations.
